properties.areaDesc: Southeast Pinal County including Kearny/Mammoth/Oracle; Tucson Metro Area including Tucson/Green Valley/Marana/Vail; Tohono O'odham Nation including Sells; South Central Pinal County including Eloy/Picacho Peak State Park
properties.headline: Hard Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 12:42PM MST until February 5 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the first Hard Freeze Watch, temperatures mainly
ranging from 23 to 27 degrees are possible. For the second Hard
Freeze Watch, temperatures mainly ranging from 20 to 26 degrees
are possible.

* WHERE...Tohono O'odham Nation, Tucson Metro Area, South
Central Pinal County and Southeast Pinal County.

* WHEN...For the first Hard Freeze Watch, from late Monday night
through Tuesday morning. For the second Hard Freeze Watch,
from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HARD FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
